page.title: 03HOLTON: POPULATION.JOBS
page.content: The hamlet of Holton is the smallest of the 3 villages in the block.The Anglican Church and Holton Hall are the 2 largest buildings.The former is partly 12th century. The Hall is an 18th C.Georgian house extended in Victorian times by the addition of 4 bays.Population of Holton consists of 28 households.There are 10 children under 18,35 working people,13 retired.There are 6 council houses, the rest are owner occupied.There are 2 working farmers.Other employment includes architecture,teaching,nursing and 2 full time artists.People enjoy living here although the amount of heavy traffic passing through is destroying the peaceful atmosphere of a village which was totally agricultural in former times.
